Title: Can the way pigs are handled alter behavioural and physiological measures of affective state?
Authors: Ricard Carreras, Laura Arroyo, Eva Mainau, Daniel Valent, Anna Bassols, Antoni Dalmau, Luigi Faucitano, Xavier Manteca, Antonio Velarde
Supporting quotes for "Age":
- "Treatments started when pigs aged 19 weeks and lasted until 27 weeks of age (slaughter age)"
  - "In this study, 56 female pigs ((Landrace x Large White) x Piétrain) were used. At 9 weeks of age, pigs were transported from a commercial farm to the experimental facilities of IRTA (Monells, Spain) and housed in two rooms of four pens with seven pigs each."
Reasoning for "Age":
The paper provides information about the age of the pigs used in the experiment:
"In this study, 56 female pigs ((Landrace x Large White) x Piétrain) were used. At 9 weeks of age, pigs were transported from a commercial farm to the experimental facilities of IRTA (Monells, Spain) and housed in two rooms of four pens with seven pigs each."
This quote indicates that the pigs were 9 weeks old when they were transported to the experimental facilities.
"Treatments started when pigs aged 19 weeks and lasted until 27 weeks of age (slaughter age)"
This quote specifies that the pigs were between 19 and 27 weeks of age during the experimental treatments.
Based on these quotes, the pigs used in the experiment were juvenile, as they were not sexually mature or close to sexual maturity at the start of the experiment (9 weeks old) and were slaughtered at 27 weeks of age, which is still before full sexual maturity.

Title: Does stocking density modify affective state in pigs as assessed by cognitive bias, behavioural and physiological parameters?

Supporting quotes for "Age":

The paper does not explicitly state the age of the pigs used in the experiment. However, it does provide some information that can be used to infer the age:

This quote indicates that the pigs were approximately 14 weeks old at the start of the experiment. Pigs typically reach sexual maturity around 5-6 months of age. Since the pigs in this study were 14 weeks old, they would not be considered sexually mature or close to sexual maturity.
